CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 10, 1955, pg. 16, reads: "'Lucky Officers' - That's the remark Police Superintendent James W. Slusser made, following Patrolman Oceanus W. Hopkins' explanation of his narrow escape from death back in 1931, when he was shot down in a battle with burglars, and lived to tell the story. The 'Hero in Blue,' with a record of twenty-five years on the police force, currently walks a beat in Mount Washington Precinct. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Police Superintendent James W. Slusser and Police Officer Oceanus W. Hopkins wearing badge 1115, seated at table
